intro: Epilobium cephalostigma f. leucanthum, commonly known as the white-flowered willow herb, is a botanical variant of the species Epilobium cephalostigma. It is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Onagraceae family, characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The most distinguishing feature is its white or pale pink flowers, which bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. It typically grows in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
